bibl.title: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Paul H. Streit, November 26, 1952

div1.p: Hench says Cubans approve of wreath laying. He suggests the Army place one for Finlay. The University of Virginia is placing one in honor of Reed, but the University of Maryland has not responded in regards to Carroll.

div1.head: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Paul H. Streit, November 26, 1952
div1.p:
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT
1206
Send the following message, subject to the terms on back hereof, which are hereby agreed to
NOVEMBER 26, 1952 Major General Paul H. Streit
Walter Reed Army Hospital
Washington, D. C.

CUBANS APPROVE WHATEVER WREATH LAYINGS WE DESIRE. WOULD BE GRACIOUS IF ARMY
LAID WREATH FOR FINLAY, REED ALSO IF WISH BUT UNIVERSITY VIRGINIA PLACING ONE
FOR REED. UNIVERSITY MARYLAND HAS NOT RESPONDED FOR CARROLL. COULD ARMY
DO THAT? HE ALONE NEGLECTED SO FAR.

SUBJECT:
Gen Streit
Cubans approve whatever
wreath layings we desire
Would be gracious if army
laid wreath for Finlay, Reed
also if wish but have University
Virginia placing one for Reed.
University Maryland has not responded
for Carroll. Could army do that
He alone neglected so far
